incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues in APAC Region

incident_updates.body: Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to investigate the source of the data connectivity issue with our carrier partners. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to investigate the source of the data connectivity issue with our carrier partners. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.

We are investigating connectivity issues when using the 'sg1.super' APN with some Super SIM IMSIs. To be impacted, devices would need to both be configured to use the 'sg1.super' APN and be using one of the impacted IMSIs to connect to the cellular networks. The 'sg1.super' APN directs Super SIM traffic to our distributed internet breakout location in Singapore. Assuming that only devices deployed in APAC or Oceania regions would be configured to the use the 'sg1.super' APN to benefit from the lower latency offered by a closer breakout location, the countries with devices most likely to be impacted are Australia, Singapore, India, and the United Arab Emirates. For other countries throughout APAC and Oceania, other, non-impacted IMSIs are preferred. However, devices deployed elsewhere in the world that are configured to use the 'sg1.super' APN may be impacted if the impacted IMSIs are preferred in those countries. If you believe you have been impacted and are able to change the APN on your devices, you can set the APN to 'super' and your data will breakout in Virginia, USA.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~2% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Super SIM Connectivity loss has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the previously reported connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 12:05 Pacific time, we observed ~2% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failures to Chile Entel and Telefonica Network From Chile Phone Numbers

incident_updates.body: Twilio SMS was degraded for 8 hours between 12:30 and 08:30 Pacific Time on 06/07/2023. During this period of time, customers may have experienced SMS delivery failures to Chile Entel and Telefonica network from Chile phone numbers. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Errors for Console and API Requests

incident_updates.body: Twilio Console, API, TaskRouter, and Debugger were degraded for 4 minutes between 06:41 and 06:44 Pacific Time on 06/07/2023. During this period of time, customers may have experienced 5XX errors for multiple API endpoints and the console. Customers were not able to make/receive calls on Flex. Webhooks for debug events were not received either. The issue has now been resolved.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Console and API. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Twilio IoT & KORE Account Linking Links Expiring

incident_updates.body: We have deployed a fix that will correctly generate a valid link visiting "Link a KORE Account" page. If you were previously blocked due to having an expired link, please try clicking the button in the Twilio Console to create your KORE account again to go to KORE and complete the account linking process.

If you previously viewed the "Link a KORE Account" page in Internet of Things section of the Twilio Console, but did not complete the process within 24 hours of first viewing the page, the link to that takes you to the KORE Console to create your account will have expired and no longer be valid. Our team has identified the issue and is actively working to resolve it. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

If you previously viewed the "Link a KORE Account" page in Internet of Things section of the Twilio Console but did not complete the process within 24 hours of first viewing the page, the link to that takes you to the KORE Console to create your account will have expired and no longer be valid. Our team is investigating how to allow you to get a refreshed link so you can complete the account linking process. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Conversations Service Returning 5xxs

incident_updates.body:
A set of Twilio services (Twilio Conversations, Sync, Verify and Flex) were degraded for 1 minute between 05:07 and 05:08 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced and elevated number of 5xx errors and latency on the API endpoints. Additionally, SDKs might have had issues connecting to Twilio websocket infrastructure. 

It is possible that due to degradation of the Twilio Conversations services, Default Conversation Service can be incorrect for some customers. If this is the case, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations and report the issue to Twilio Support for Tracking Purposes. The issue has now been resolved.

A set of Twilio services (Twilio Conversations, Sync, Verify and Flex) were degraded for 1 minute between 05:07 and 05:08 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced and elevated number of 5xx errors and latency on the API endpoints. Additionally, SDKs might have had issues connecting to Twilio websocket infrastructure. 

It is possible that due to degradation of the Twilio Conversations services, Default Conversation Service can be incorrect for some customers. If this is the case, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations and report the issue to Twilio Support for Tracking Purposes. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Conversations. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Billing Issues With Subset of IoT Customers

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have deployed a fix, and the service has recovered fully. This incident has been resolved.

Since midnight UTC today, IoT usage from May 28 through May 31st has been incorrectly counted twice when calculating your Twilio account balance. This would have caused your account balance to appear lower than it should and may have led to your credit card being charged to bring your account balance back up to amount set in your auto recharge settings. Our engineering team is currently working on stopping the double counting of the usage so your balance will be correctly reflected, including any additional funds that may have been added to your account from your auto recharge being triggered.

We expect to provide another update in 4 hours, or as soon as we have more information.

Since midnight UTC today, IoT usage from May 28 through May 31st has been incorrectly counted twice when calculating your Twilio account balance. Our engineering team is currently working on stopping the double counting of the usage so your balance will be correctly reflected, including any additional funds that may have been added to your account from your auto recharge being triggered.

We expect to provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Live Logging Issues

incident_updates.body: Live logging was degraded for 2 hours and 47 minutes between 06:01 and 08:48 Pacific Time on 06/01/2023.
